":"function"},{"inputs":[{"internalType":"bytes32","name":"role","type":"bytes32"},{"internalType":"address","name":"account","type":"address"}],"name":"revokeRole","outputs":[],"stateMutability":"nonpayable","type":"function"},{"inputs":[{"internalType":"bytes4","name":"interfaceId","type":"bytes4"}],"name":"supportsInterface","outputs":[{"internalType":"bool","name":"","type":"bool"}],"stateMutability":"view","type":"function"},{"inputs":[],"name":"withdrawAddress","outputs":[{"internalType":"address","name":"","type":"address"}],"stateMutability":"view","type":"function"},{"inputs":[{"internalType":"bool","name":"_withdraw","type":"bool"},{"internalType":"uint256","name":"_value","type":"uint256"},{"internalType":"address","name":"_toPay","type":"address"}],"name":"withdrawFunds","outputs":[],"stateMutability":"nonpayable","type":"function"},{"inputs":[],"name":"withdrawValue","outputs":[{"internalType":"uint256","name":"","type":"uint256"}],"stateMutability":"view","type":"function"}],"devdoc":{"kind":"dev","methods":{"addConfirmer(address)":{"details":"Adds another confirmer role to the smart contract, which can confirm withdraw of funds and do nothing else"},"addWithdrawer(address)":{"details":"Adds another withdrawer role to the smart contract, which can withdraw funds and do nothing else"},"cancelWithdraw()":{"details":"- Cancels the withdraw and resets all variables. Would be used in the case of a typo from the initial withdrawer"},"changeOwner(address)":{"details":"- Changes the owner to a new address"},"getRoleAdmin(bytes32)":{"details":"Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}."},"grantRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role."},"hasRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Returns `true` if `account` has been granted `role`."},"initiateWithdraw(uint256,address)":{"details":"- The first step in the withdrawal process, sets the address to pay and the value, and also tells the confirmer that everything is ready to check"},"ownerWithdraw(uint256)":{"details":"- The backdoor withdraw feature for the admin/owner address"},"removeConfirmer(address)":{"details":"removes the withdraw role from an address, meaning they can no longer withdraw funds"},"removeWithdrawer(address)":{"details":"removes the confirmer role from an address, meaning they can no longer confirm withdraw of funds"},"renounceRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `account`."},"revokeRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role."},"supportsInterface(bytes4)":{"details":"See {IERC165-supportsInterface}."},"withdrawFunds(bool,uint256,address)":{"details":"- Withdraws funds from Aave then to the msg.sender. Only works if the withdraw has been initated by the WITHDRAW_ROLE. Double confirms the value and toPay to ensure that no malicious WITHDRAW_ROLE could change the address and value mid-execution"}},"version":1},"userdoc":{"kind":"user","methods":{},"version":1}},"settings":{"compilationTarget":{"/C/Users/murrl/GithubRepos/PrescryptivePOC/Truffle/contracts/PrescryptiveSmartContract.sol":"PrescryptiveSmartContract"},"evmVersion":"constantinople","libraries":{},"metadata":{"bytecodeHash":"ipfs"},"optimizer":{"enabled":false,"runs":200},"remappings":[]},"sources":{"/C/Users/murrl/GithubRepos/PrescryptivePOC/Truffle/contracts/PrescryptiveSmartContract.sol":{"keccak256":"0x344095b9498f0c2da9d5c495e342d984176ac430f8599bff5e9cb09dc8c14287","license":"UNLICENSED","urls":["bzz-raw://521bb59c09654dae390b509115e592eeabcf22b1a28f48196ef6240066cf48e0","dweb:/ipfs/QmQ653VKEQwhPzNJN3cDeC3M8ZGFabzUbNHAix2d9WYDmr"]},"/C/Users/murrl/GithubRepos/PrescryptivePOC/node_modules/@aave/protocol-v2/contracts/dependencies/openzeppelin/contracts/Address.sol":{"keccak256":"0x429dba7b2b984fd8a6e3bf617ac5b110c1d0b9430920ee09085faf7d40d008ba","license":"agpl-3.0","urls":["bzz-raw://26c4956080bfc10505c3992c001d94f0f3760d9e5a9d5d8606a89e65846f82cd","dweb:/ipfs/QmdBY3PNmvdkjJef4VNP3XcHarNKXJz1NWvEKNi1HV1RnC"]},"/C/Users/murrl/GithubRepos/PrescryptivePOC/node_modules/@aave/protocol-v2/contracts/dependencies/openzeppelin/contracts/IERC20.sol":{"keccak256":"0x4a0dc846ebaf1910c27d4fd55faedd4eaf6b3990f3c8df50794f7802fb99d69e","license":"agpl-3.0","urls":["bzz-raw://f8e903be1bf1ed65aa12d9e9f1a85893a93dd2201edf99a2ef3b3f2a9bbcf421","dweb:/ipfs/QmWkChh6UPKQdpTiMWa2gakkjw7LwQyyioJZgaQR7qR7ek"]},"/C/Users/murrl/GithubRepos/PrescryptivePOC/node_modules/@aave/protocol-v2/contracts/dependencies/openzeppelin/contracts/SafeERC20.sol":{"keccak256":"0x514686a036d967727aef9979e42e26c981cbe65b7c3f707453bfb6b2c9699f6b","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://7d55dca335d428b866ac1b0335955c5f5e39bee587efd8a15313b2a322862f61","dweb:/ipfs/QmQRR3XXY2Y9zzqwCxdp5UbkxGmXLVs8F9wFwFafEELVAw"]},"/C/Users/murrl/GithubRepos/PrescryptivePOC/node_modules/@aave/protocol-v2/contracts/dependencies/openzeppelin/contracts/ documentation.text: @dev - Changes the owner to a new address
@dev Adds another withdrawer role to the smart contract, which can withdraw funds and do nothing else
@dev removes the confirmer role from an address, meaning they can no longer confirm withdraw of funds
@dev Adds another confirmer role to the smart contract, which can confirm withdraw of funds and do nothing else
@dev removes the withdraw role from an address, meaning they can no longer withdraw funds
@dev - The first step in the withdrawal process, sets the address to pay and the value, and also tells the confirmer that everything is ready to check
@dev - Cancels the withdraw and resets all variables. Would be used in the case of a typo from the initial withdrawer

@dev - Withdraws funds from Aave then to the msg.sender. Only works if the withdraw has been initated by the WITHDRAW_ROLE. Double confirms the value and toPay to ensure that no malicious
 WITHDRAW_ROLE could change the address and value mid-execution
@dev - The backdoor withdraw feature for the admin/owner address

attributes.text: @dev - Changes the owner to a new address
@dev Adds another withdrawer role to the smart contract, which can withdraw funds and do nothing else
@dev removes the confirmer role from an address, meaning they can no longer confirm withdraw of funds
@dev Adds another confirmer role to the smart contract, which can confirm withdraw of funds and do nothing else
@dev removes the withdraw role from an address, meaning they can no longer withdraw funds
@dev - The first step in the withdrawal process, sets the address to pay and the value, and also tells the confirmer that everything is ready to check
@dev - Cancels the withdraw and resets all variables. Would be used in the case of a typo from the initial withdrawer

@dev - Withdraws funds from Aave then to the msg.sender. Only works if the withdraw has been initated by the WITHDRAW_ROLE. Double confirms the value and toPay to ensure that no malicious
 WITHDRAW_ROLE could change the address and value mid-execution
@dev - The backdoor withdraw feature for the admin/owner address

addConfirmer(address).details: Adds another confirmer role to the smart contract, which can confirm withdraw of funds and do nothing else

addWithdrawer(address).details: Adds another withdrawer role to the smart contract, which can withdraw funds and do nothing else

cancelWithdraw().details: - Cancels the withdraw and resets all variables. Would be used in the case of a typo from the initial withdrawer

changeOwner(address).details: - Changes the owner to a new address

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

grantRole(bytes32,address).details: Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role.

initiateWithdraw(uint256,address).details: - The first step in the withdrawal process, sets the address to pay and the value, and also tells the confirmer that everything is ready to check

ownerWithdraw(uint256).details: - The backdoor withdraw feature for the admin/owner address

removeConfirmer(address).details: removes the withdraw role from an address, meaning they can no longer withdraw funds

removeWithdrawer(address).details: removes the confirmer role from an address, meaning they can no longer confirm withdraw of funds

renounceRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `account`.

revokeRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role.

withdrawFunds(bool,uint256,address).details: - Withdraws funds from Aave then to the msg.sender. Only works if the withdraw has been initated by the WITHDRAW_ROLE. Double confirms the value and toPay to ensure that no malicious WITHDRAW_ROLE could change the address and value mid-execution
